column2: LOUISIANA DMV DRIVING TEST
column4: Louisiana

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Brake lightly.
column6: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.
column8: Shift to a lower gear.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: 4-way stop
column8: You must turn right

column2: 3. If your gas pedal is stuck, you should:
column4: ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: try pumping it to increase pressure.
column8: turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column10: hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it. If not, shift into neutral and use the brake to slow your vehicle and get off the road.

column2: 4. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
column8: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.

column2: 5. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column6: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: increase your speed and move to the left.
column10: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.

column2: 6. Your BAC depends on:
column4: how much time passes between drinks.
column8: how much alcohol you drink.

column2: 7. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car approaching from the left.
column6: The car approaching from the right.
column8: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.
column10: The car that is traveling faster.

column2: 8. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column4: Service signs
column8: Warning signs

column2: 9. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column10: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down or stop
column6: Yield the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles
column8: You must make a complete stop

column2: 11. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: All of the above.
column6: quick lane changes without a signal.
column8: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.

column2: 12. Alcohol:
column4: makes drivers more prone to take chances.
column8: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.

column2: 13. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right.
column8: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.

column2: 14. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: right turns are not allowed.
column8: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column10: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 15. When you get in a car to drive, the first thing you should do is:
column4: adjust the steering wheel.
column8: check your rear view mirror.

column2: 16. When you come to an intersection with a flashing red light, you must:
column4: slow down and drive carefully through the  intersection.
column6: stop at the intersection and wait for a flashing green light.
column8: stop only if cars are approaching the intersection.
column10: stop at the intersection, then proceed when safe and observe the right-of-way rules.

column2: 17. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: only if the traffic signal turns red.
column8: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 18. When a traffic signal light turns green, you should:
column4: back up slowly.
column8: wait 5 seconds before proceeding.
column10: yield the right-of-way to larger vehicles.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column4: Merge
column8: Lane change

column2: 20. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column10: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: No U-turn
column8: Detour ahead

column2: 22. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
column8: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column10: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.

column2: 23. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column6: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.
column8: they must change lane immediately.

column2: 24. The minimum drinking age in this State is ____ years.
25. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: not drive faster than 25 MPH.
column6: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
column8: slow down.

column2: 26. This sign means:
column4: Traffic signal ahead
column8: No traffic signal ahead
column10: The traffic signal is not operational

column2: 27. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: must cross the intersection immdiately.
column6: must always come to a complete stop.
column8: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
column10: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.

column2: 28. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column4: They are hard to see in traffic.
column8: They obey specific traffic laws.

column2: 29. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.
column6: the speed limit on that route.
column8: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
column10: the type of route you are on.

column2: 30. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the right curb or edge of the road.
column6: near the left edge of the road.
column8: on the left shoulder of the road.

column2: 31. Drive below the posted speed limit when:
column4: anything makes conditions less than perfect.
column6: you are on a four lane road.
column8: others drive below the speed limit.
column10: entering a highway where there are other cars.

column2: 32. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a winding road.
column8: a cross road.

column2: 33. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: signal turns, lane changes and stops.
column6: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column8: wear approved helmets.

column2: 34. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column8: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
column10: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.

column2: 35. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: turn left into the one-way road.
column8: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column10: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.

column2: 36. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column8: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.

column2: 37. A steady yellow light at an intersection means:
column4: Slow down and be prepared to stop
column6: Immediately come to a complete stop
column8: Proceed with caution through the intersection

column2: 38. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column8: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.

column2: 39. When approaching a railroad crossing drivers should:
column4: slow down.
column8: look for a train.

column2: 40. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column6: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column10: stop doing what they are doing.
